meanings.definition: To declare the punishment decided for a crime.
meanings.sent1: The judge sentenced the criminal to five years in prison.
meanings.sent2: The court sentenced the thief to community service.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was sentenced to time-out for knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The storm sentenced the town to days of heavy rain and flooding.
meanings.sent5: The teacher sentenced the student to extra homework for not completing the assignment.

meanings.definition: To impose a punishment on someone for a crime.
meanings.sent1: The jury sentenced the defendant to pay a fine for the offense.
meanings.sent2: The judge sentenced the criminal to probation instead of jail time.
meanings.sent3: The misbehaving puppy was sentenced to wear a cone of shame.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter sentenced the garden to frost and snow.
meanings.sent5: The coach sentenced the player to extra drills for breaking team rules.
